p: A number of in silico studies on antiflavivirals have been used to inform further in vitro and in vivo testing. For example, molecular modeling of the protease-inhibitor complex of potential ZIKV antivirals was used to identify structural scaffolds for allosteric small-molecule inhibitors of the ZIKV NS2B-NS3 protease, and the most potent inhibitors were then tested both in vitro in human fetal neural progenitor cells and in vivo in mice and found to demonstrate inhibition of ZIKV propagation (Shiryaev et al., 2017).
